DataElement.preferredName: Recurrent Disease Favorable Histology Wilms Tumor Patient Full Recovery Toxic Effect Prior Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The question that asks whether or not a patient having relapsed favorable histology Wilms tumor has recovered from toxic effects of all prior therapy prior to entering the study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Recurrent Disease Favorable Histology Wilms Tumor Patient Full Recovery Toxic Effect Prior Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of remission._Expressing something as positive, advantageous or desired._The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains._An embryonal neoplasm characterized by the presence of epithelial, mesenchymal, and blastema components. The vast majority of cases arise from the kidney. A small number of cases with morphologic features resembling Wilms tumor of the kidney have been reported arising from the ovary and the cervix._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Containing as much or as many as is possible or normal._A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury._Having to do with poison or something harmful to the body. Toxic substances usually cause unwanted side effects._A phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon._Earlier in time or order._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Recurrent Disease Favorable Histology Wilms Tumor Patient
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.:Expressing something as positive, advantageous or desired.:The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.:An embryonal neoplasm characterized by the presence of epithelial, mesenchymal, and blastema components. The vast majority of cases arise from the kidney. A small number of cases with morphologic features resembling Wilms tumor of the kidney have been reported arising from the ovary and the cervix.:A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.
Expressing something as positive, advantageous or desired.

The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

An embryonal neoplasm characterized by the presence of epithelial, mesenchymal, and blastema components. The vast majority of cases arise from the kidney. A small number of cases with morphologic features resembling Wilms tumor of the kidney have been reported arising from the ovary and the cervix.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Full Recovery Toxic Effect Prior Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Containing as much or as many as is possible or normal.:A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.:Having to do with poison or something harmful to the body. Toxic substances usually cause unwanted side effects. :A phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.:Earlier in time or order.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Containing as much or as many as is possible or normal.
A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.
Having to do with poison or something harmful to the body. Toxic substances usually cause unwanted side effects.
A phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has relapsed favor
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has relapsed favorable histology Wilms tumor, did patient fully recover from the acute toxic effects of all prior chemotherapy, immunotherapy, or radiotherapy prior to entering this study?

DataElement.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
